de.esoco.process

Class ProcessRelationTypes

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.process.ProcessRelationTypes

  • @Annotations.RelationTypeNamespace(value="de.esoco.process")
public class ProcessRelationTypes
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains process-specific relation type declarations.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ProcessRelationTypes.ListAction
      An enumeration of generic actions that can be applied to lists of objects.

      • SPAWN_PROCESSES

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<ProcessState>> SPAWN_PROCESSES
        A list of process states that will be evaluated to spawn new processes separate from the current process context. The process states are typically created by a ProcessExecutor instance that can be queried from the process parameter PROCESS_EXECUTOR. This list will be cleared by an interaction (which will first spawn the new processes).

        A list of parameter relation types that are required to be available when the process is executed.

        A list of parameter relation types that can optionally be set as input values when the process is executed.

      • INTERACTION_PARAMS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>> INTERACTION_PARAMS
        A list of the parameter relation types to be used in an interaction. This relation must be set on a process step.

      • INPUT_PARAMS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Set<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>> INPUT_PARAMS
        A set of the parameter relation types that are used as input parameters in an interaction. These must be a subset of the parameters stored in INTERACTION_PARAMS.

      • VIEW_PARAMS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Set<org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>>>> VIEW_PARAMS
        A set of the parameter relation types that should be displayed in additional views.

      • INTERACTION_EVENT_PARAM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> INTERACTION_EVENT_PARAM
        Contains the relation type of the INTERACTION_PARAMS parameter that caused an interactive input event during an interaction. This parameter should preferably be queried by steps through the method ProcessFragment.getInteractiveInputParameter().

      • INTERACTION_EVENT_TYPE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<de.esoco.lib.property.InteractionEventType> INTERACTION_EVENT_TYPE
        The event type of an interaction.

      • INTERACTION_CLEANUP_ACTIONS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<java.lang.Runnable>> INTERACTION_CLEANUP_ACTIONS
        A list of actions that will be performed once before the next process execution after an interaction.

      • CONTINUATION_PARAMS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Set<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>>> CONTINUATION_PARAMS
        A set of the interaction parameters that will continue the process if they cause an interaction. This are typically enumerated interaction parameters with the style ListStyle.IMMEDIATE. This relation must be set on a process step.

      • CONTINUATION_PARAM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> CONTINUATION_PARAM
        A process parameter that contains the interaction parameter that caused the most recent continuation. See parameter CONTINUATION_PARAMS for more information.

      • CONTINUATION_FRAGMENT_CLASS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessFragment>> CONTINUATION_FRAGMENT_CLASS
        A process parameter that contains the class of the InteractionFragment that caused the most recent continuation. See parameter CONTINUATION_PARAMS for more information.

      • STOP_PROCESS_EXECUTION

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> STOP_PROCESS_EXECUTION
        If this flag is set on a process it should gracefully end its execution as soon as possible. This flag should be queried and responded to in reasonable intervals.

      • AUTO_CONTINUE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> AUTO_CONTINUE
        Signals that a process should automatically continue to run after a process interaction. This can be used to interactively display intermediate results of a process. This can be used to create repeated process loops where an interactive step displays the results or the progress of an operation. The re-execution of the process must be handled by the code which handles the interaction.

      • AUTO_UPDATE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> AUTO_UPDATE
        Similar to AUTO_CONTINUE but stays in the same interaction when the process is re-executed (instead of continuing with the next process step). This can be used to inform the user while an interactive step prepares data during it's initialization or because of an interaction. The update of the interaction will continue as long as this flag is set. Because this is basically an endless loop the code setting this flag must take appropriate measures to reduce the processing load on the client and server (e.g. by invoking Thread.sleep(long) between invocations.

      • FINAL_STEP

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> FINAL_STEP
        A flag to indicate that a certain process step is the final interactive step. This can be evaluated by the user interface code to show a hint that the process will be finished afterwards.

      • PROCESS_SESSION_EXPIRED

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> PROCESS_SESSION_EXPIRED
        If the process is associated with a session (e.g. in an application server) this flag can be used to indicate if a session has expired.

      • IMMEDIATE_INTERACTION

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> IMMEDIATE_INTERACTION
        A flag that can be set to mark a process step that has one or more interactive parameters which will cause an immediate execution of the process. This can be used by the user interface as a hint that no extra execution control ('next button') needs to be displayed.

      • RELOAD_CURRENT_STEP

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> RELOAD_CURRENT_STEP
        This relation type serves as an indicator that the current step should be reloaded (i.e. prepared again) during an interaction. It doesn't need to be set as a parameter but should instead only be set in the relation with the type INTERACTION_EVENT_PARAM.

      • TRANSACTION_START

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> TRANSACTION_START
        Indicates that the process step on which this flag is set should be the starting point of a transaction. The transaction will be committed when a step is reached that has the flag TRANSACTION_END set. Setting both flags on the same step would have the same effect as setting the single flag MetaTypes.TRANSACTIONAL which should therefore be preferred.

      • TRANSACTION_END

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> TRANSACTION_END
        Indicates that the process step on which this flag is set should be the end point of a transaction. A transaction that had been started previously by a step with the flag TRANSACTION_START will be committed. If the numbers of start and end points of transactions don't match an exception will occur.

      • HISTORY_START

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> HISTORY_START
        Indicates that the process step on which this flag is set should be the starting point of a history group. The group will be closed when a step is reached that has the flag HISTORY_END set. Setting both flags on the same step would have the same effect as setting the single flag HistoryManager.HISTORIZED which should therefore be preferred.

        The History flags implicitly include the TRANSACTION_START and TRANSACTION_END flags to group history changes and transactional code of the process steps in a transaction. It would be redundant to set these flags too and it should therefore be avoided.

      • HISTORY_END

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Boolean> HISTORY_END
        Indicates that the process step on which this flag is set should be the end point of a history group. A group that had been started previously by a step with the flag HISTORY_START will be closed. If the numbers of start and end points of history groups don't match an exception will occur.

      • HISTORY_TARGET_PARAM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<? extends Entity>> HISTORY_TARGET_PARAM
        A reference to another parameter that contains the target entity for a history record.

      • HISTORY_VALUE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> HISTORY_VALUE
        A string parameter that can contain the value for a history entry.

      • PROCESS_STEP_MESSAGE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROCESS_STEP_MESSAGE
        A string containing a message for the current process step.

      • PROCESS_STEP_INFO

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROCESS_STEP_INFO
        An information string for the current process step.

      • PROCESS_RESULT

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROCESS_RESULT
        A string containing result informations for the current process step.

      • PROCESS_STEP_STYLE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROCESS_STEP_STYLE
        An style string for the current process step. This style can be used to influence the rendering of interactive steps in user interfaces.

      • SOURCE_PARAM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> SOURCE_PARAM
        A reference to a source parameter type.

      • TARGET_PARAM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> TARGET_PARAM
        A reference to a target parameter type.

      • ENTITY_PARAM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<? extends Entity>> ENTITY_PARAM
        A reference to an entity parameter type.

      • ENTITY_UPDATE_ACTION

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<de.esoco.lib.expression.Action<Entity>> ENTITY_UPDATE_ACTION
        A reference to an action that will be invoked to update an entity.

      • ENTITY_TYPE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> ENTITY_TYPE
        A string containing an entity type name for display or selection.

      • PARAM_VALIDATIONS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<?,java.lang.String>>> PARAM_VALIDATIONS
        A mapping from parameter relation types to functions that validate parameter values. If the parameter value is valid the function must return NULL and else a string containing the reason why the validation failed (typically a resource identifier that will be displayed in the user interface). The relation will always return at least an empty map, never NULL.

      • INTERACTION_PARAM_VALIDATIONS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Map<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>,de.esoco.lib.expression.Function<?,java.lang.String>>> INTERACTION_PARAM_VALIDATIONS
        A mapping from parameter relation types to functions that validate parameter values already during interactions while the validations stored in PARAM_VALIDATIONS will only be performed if the process progresses to the next step.

      • ALLOWED_VALUES

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Collection<?>> ALLOWED_VALUES
        An ordered list of strings that constrains the values from which a certain process parameter can be selected. Created as a standard relation type without an initial value to allow easier detection of the constraint.

      • ORIGINAL_RELATION_TYPE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> ORIGINAL_RELATION_TYPE
        A reference to a the original relation type of a derived parameter type. See method deriveParameter(String, RelationType) for details.

      • DATA_ELEMENT

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<DataElement<?>> DATA_ELEMENT
        A reference to a data element that has been created by this factory.

      • PROCESS_SCHEDULER

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<ProcessScheduler> PROCESS_SCHEDULER
        A relation type for references to process scheduler instances.

      • EXTERNAL_SERVICE_ACCESS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<ExternalServiceAccess> EXTERNAL_SERVICE_ACCESS
        A reference to an object that provides access to external services through an ExternalServiceAccess interface.

      • PROGRESS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Integer> PROGRESS
        An integer value containing a value indicating the progress of a process in percent.

      • PROGRESS_MAXIMUM

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.Integer> PROGRESS_MAXIMUM
        The maximum value for the progress indicator.

      • PROGRESS_INDICATOR

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROGRESS_INDICATOR
        A string indicator for the progress of a process.

      • PROGRESS_INDICATOR_TEMPLATE

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROGRESS_INDICATOR_TEMPLATE
        A string containing the formatting template for the progress indication parameter PROGRESS_INDICATOR. It must contain two integer formatting references (%d), the first for the current progress and the second for the progress maximum.

      • PROGRESS_DESCRIPTION

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> PROGRESS_DESCRIPTION
        A string description of the current process progress.

      • CONFIGURATION

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration> CONFIGURATION
        A process parameter that contains the configuration of the application in which the process is running.

      • RESUME_PROCESSES

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.List<java.lang.Class<? extends ProcessDefinition>>> RESUME_PROCESSES
        A list of process definition classes for background process that shall be resumed by a ProcessScheduler. Will be evaluated after a process has finished execution of it's steps.

      • LIST_ACTION

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<ProcessRelationTypes.ListAction> LIST_ACTION
        An interactive enum parameter to perform list actions.

      • PARAM_UPDATE_LISTENERS

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.util.Set<de.esoco.lib.property.Updatable>> PARAM_UPDATE_LISTENERS
        A relation that refers to a set of parameter update listeners that will be notified if a parameter is modified. This relation is intended to be set on interactions, not as a process parameter.

      • INTERACTION_FILL

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> INTERACTION_FILL
        A string parameter to be used as an empty placeholder in an interaction layout. Typically without content, label, and tooltip.

      • DUMMY_PARAMETER

        public static final org.obrel.core.RelationType<java.lang.String> DUMMY_PARAMETER
        A string parameter that can be added or removes as an "invisible" interaction parameter to force a layout rebuild

    • Method Detail

      • deriveParameter

        public static <T> org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> deriveParameter(java.lang.String sPrefix,
                                                                 org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rRelationType)
        Creates a new parameter relation type that is derived from an existing relation type. The new type will have the same target datatype as the original type and a name that is created from the process package, the optional prefix, and the simple name of the original type. The original type will be stored in a relation of type ORIGINAL_RELATION_TYPE on the derived type. The prefix must be in relation type notation, i.e. upper case words separated by underscores.
        Parameters:
        sPrefix - The optional prefix to prepend to the original type's name (can be NULL or empty for none)
        rRelationType - The relation type to derive the parameter from
        Returns:
        The new derived parameter type

      • deriveParameters

        public static java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> deriveParameters(java.lang.String sPrefix,
                                                                              org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>... rRelationTypes)
        Creates a list of derived parameter relation types. For details see method deriveParameter(String, RelationType). The returned list can be manipulated freely.
        Parameters:
        sPrefix - The optional prefix to prepend to the original type names (can be NULL or empty for none)
        rRelationTypes - The relation types to derive the parameters from
        Returns:
        A list of new derived parameters types

      • deriveParameters

        public static java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> deriveParameters(java.lang.String sPrefix,
                                                                              java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rRelationTypes)
        Creates a list of derived parameter relation types. For details see method deriveParameter(String, RelationType). The returned list can be manipulated freely.
        Parameters:
        sPrefix - The optional prefix to prepend to the original type names (can be NULL or empty for none)
        rRelationTypes - The relation types to derive the parameters from
        Returns:
        A list of new derived parameters types

      • getDerivedParameter

        public static <T> org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> getDerivedParameter(org.obrel.core.RelationType<T> rOriginalType,
                                                                     java.util.List<org.obrel.core.RelationType<?>> rDerivedParams)
        Returns the derived parameter relation type for a certain original relation type from a list of derived types.
        Parameters:
        rOriginalType - The original relation type
        rDerivedParams - A list of derived parameter types
        Returns:
        The derived parameter relation type or NULL if not found
